org.robobrain.sdk.graphics
Class Sprite

java.lang.Object
  org.robobrain.sdk.graphics.Renderable
      org.robobrain.sdk.graphics.Sprite

public class Sprite
extends Renderable

An animated Renderable object. Draws an animated Texture to the screen. It is in effect a Sprite sheet.Note: The Sprite's origin is at the center of it's bounding Rectangle.

Author:
James Johnson

Constructor Detail

Sprite

public Sprite(Texture texture,
              int width,
              int height,
              int numFrames)
Initializes the Sprite. Note: Sprites default to an animation frame rate of 15fps.

Parameters:
texture - The Texture containing all of the animation frames for this Sprite. Please note that all textures must be sized to a power of 2. (e.g. 32x32 pixels, 64x64 pixels, etc)
width - The width of one frame in pixels.
height - The height of one frame in pixels.
numFrames - The total number of frames in the animation.
Method Detail

update

public void update(long time)
Updates the Renderable each frame and advances the animation.

Overrides:
update in class Renderable
Parameters:
time - The number of milliseconds elapsed since the last frame.

Draws the Texture to the screen.

Overrides:
draw in class Renderable
Parameters:
gl - A valid OpenGL ES 1.0 object.

play

public void play()
Starts playing the Sprite's animation.

stop

public void stop()
Stops the Sprite from playing it's animation.

setFrame

public void setFrame(int frame)
Set the current frame number.

Parameters:

Gets the current frame number.

getWidth

public int getWidth()
Gets the width of the Sprite. It is equal to the width of one frame of animation.

Overrides:
getWidth in class Renderable
Returns:
The width of the SimpleSprite in pixels.

getHeight

public int getHeight()
Gets the height of the Sprite. It is equal to the width of one frame of animation.

Overrides:

Returns:
The height of the SimpleSprite in pixels.

Overrides:
